Finally, subgroup A”3 represented by (
A (
c )), (
Q (
c )) and (
R (
c )) samples, was characterized by a similar percentage of sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (31.2–33.2%), oxygenated sesquiterpenes (20.4–25.5%) and others (0–1.0%). (
A (
c )) essential oil was characterized by a higher content of τ-cadinol (18.3%), germacrene D (15.3%), β-pinene (10.5%), while Portugal essential oils (
Q (
c )) and (
R (
c )) was richer in terms of δ-cadinene (7.5–9.8%), β-caryophyllene (5.4–4.6%), α-cadinol (4.2–4.6%), respectively. However, the common point of these oils was the low or the completely absence percentage of the others class (O, ≤1.2%).
